title: Data Cleaning
text: recode_race - able accept: ethnicity race, race , LOINC codes, ‘Multi-race Status’ variable VRBIS. Set abbr_names TRUE abbreviate long category names .e. “American Indian Alaska Native” “AI/”. using ethnicity race, use order recode_race(ethnicity, race). recode_gender - can used CalREDIE VRBIS; aims use inclusive terms possible. recode_orientation - created specifically CalREDIE. Expects CTCIAdtlDemOrient variable. age_groups - several presets grouping age: cair2 peds: <12 M, 12-15 M, 16-23 M, 24 M, 25-47 M, 4-6 Years, 6+ Years covid: 0-17, 18-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-54, 55-64, 65-74, 75-84, 85+ decade: 0-9, 10-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70-79, 80+ enteric: 0-4, 5-14, 15-24, 25-44, 45-64, 65+ flu vax: 0-18, 19-49, 50-64, 65+ hcv: 0-17, 18-39, 40-59, 60+ mpox: 0-15, 16-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-54, 55-64, 65+ school: 0-4, 5-11, 12-17, 18-64, 65+ wnv: 0-17, 18-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-54, 55-64, 65+ Example: Frequency table percentage using add_percent incidence rates using rate_per_100k:
code: linelist <- linelist %>%   mutate(     Gender = recode_gender(Gender),     race_ethnicity = recode_race(Ethnicity, Race, abbr_names = TRUE),     age_group = age_groups(Age, type = "school"),     SexualOrientation = recode_orientation(SexualOrientation)   ) linelist %>%   count(age_group) %>%   mutate(     percent = add_percent(n),     rate = case_when(       age_group == "0-4" ~ rate_per_100k(n, 100000, digits = 1),       age_group == "5-11" ~ rate_per_100k(n, 300000, digits = 1),       age_group == "12-17" ~ rate_per_100k(n, 500000, digits = 1),       age_group == "18-64" ~ rate_per_100k(n, 1000000, digits = 1),       age_group == "65+" ~ rate_per_100k(n, 2000000, digits = 1)       )     ) #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   age_group     n percent  rate #>   <fct>     <int>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0-4           5    4.76   5   #> 2 5-11          9    8.57   3   #> 3 12-17         8    7.62   1.6 #> 4 18-64        54   51.4    5.4 #> 5 65+          29   27.6    1.4

title: Data Cleaning
text: best attempt standardize clean addresses clean_address. function : convert characters title casing, recode abbreviated cardinal directions, recode abbreviated street endings (.e. Street, Circle, Plaza). occasion need drop additional address data (.e. Apartment, Unit), can done using keep_extra.
code: cases <- data.frame(   Address = c("1234 Main Street Apt 204","501 N Capital St","233 W Green Plz Unit 3") )  cases %>%   mutate(     Address_clean = clean_address(Address, keep_extra = TRUE)     ) #>                    Address                  Address_clean #> 1 1234 Main Street Apt 204 1234 Main Street Apartment 204 #> 2         501 N Capital St       501 North Capital Street #> 3   233 W Green Plz Unit 3    233 West Green Plaza Unit 3

title: Data Cleaning
text: also attempt standardize phone number 10 digit U.S. format. removing country code symbols, length 10 characters, returned value NA.

title: Data Cleaning
text: Census tract across datasets always - contain state county fips codes, . make match, use recode_ctract remove state county fips code.

title: Data Cleaning
text: Core functions: vrbis_manner_death - expects “Manner Death” variable, follows CCDF data dictionary vrbis_place_death - expects “Place Death (Facility)”, follows CCDF data dictionary vrbis_resident - determine death belongs local health jurisdiction use vrbis_resident, need know county fips code CCDF county code (appendix G). Returned output 0/1 1 indicates death belongs county. columns, ’ll need (order): “Place Death (Facility)”, “County Death (Code)”, “Decedents County Residence (NCHS Code)”. Next, plug fips code fips CCDF county code county arguments.
code: vrbis_manner_death("A") #> [1] "Accident"  vrbis_place_death(6) #> [1] "LTCF" df <- df %>%   mutate(     lhj_resident = vrbis_resident(       place_of_death,       county_of_death_code,       decedents_county_of_residence_NCHS_Code,       fips = "059",       county = "30"       )     ) %>%   filter(lhj_resident == 1)

title: Data Cleaning
text: Small cell sizes may need suppressed protect patient confidentiality prior reporting. example, cell sizes less_than 10 suppressed replace_with double asterisk.
code: linelist %>% count(age_group) %>% mutate(n_suppress = suppress(n, less_than = 10, replace_with = "**")) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   age_group     n n_suppress #>   <fct>     <int> <chr>      #> 1 0-4           5 **         #> 2 5-11          9 **         #> 3 12-17         8 **         #> 4 18-64        54 54         #> 5 65+          29 29

title: Data Cleaning
text: Depending unit/program policy, mention HIV AIDS may need removed dataset. yet exhaustive, function accounts several variations HIV AIDS. found, warning message printed console.
code: df <- data.frame(cause = c("cancer","hepatitis","COVID-19","HIV")) print(df) #>       cause #> 1    cancer #> 2 hepatitis #> 3  COVID-19 #> 4       HIV  df <- hiv_redact(df) #> Warning in hiv_redact(df): HIV/AIDS data detected. print(df) #>       cause #> 1    cancer #> 2 hepatitis #> 3  COVID-19 #> 4

title: Data Cleaning
text: Removes variants baby/twin/newborn first name. Addresses data quality issue birth hepatitis B doses.
code: baby_name("baby BOY") #> [1] NA  baby_name("NEWBORN") #> [1] NA  baby_name("twin A") #> [1] NA

title: Data Cleaning
text: remove_empty_cols drops columns data.frame blank (represented NA ““)
code: df <- data.frame(a = c(NA,NA,NA), b = c("","",""), c = c(1,2,3)) print(df) #>    a b c #> 1 NA   1 #> 2 NA   2 #> 3 NA   3  df <- remove_empty_cols(df) #> 2 columns dropped. print(df) #>   c #> 1 1 #> 2 2 #> 3 3

title: Date Conversions
text: Core Functions: mmwr_year - calculate epidemiological year mmwr_week - calculate epidemiological week (disease week) week_ending_date - calculate Saturday disease week mmwr_calendar - returns data.frame columns disease week, week start end date, given epidemiological year mmwrweek_to_date - calculate week ending date epidemiological year week Convert epidemiological year week week ending date: make mmwr_calendar total disease weeks + start/end dates:

title: Date Conversions
text: epidemiologists working viral respiratory surveillance, patients/laboratory results can also categorized season. Season context spans week 40 current year week 39 following year.

title: Date Conversions
text: alternative grouping cases year week level month. Returned output date formatted YYYY-MM-01.

title: Date Conversions
text: time_between calculates time elapsed two dates following units: days, weeks, months years. Value always rounded account complete elapsed time. Note: order dates necessarily matter, beware sign.
code: episode_date = as.Date("2020-04-01") death_date = as.Date("2020-05-15")  time_between(death_date, episode_date, unit = "days") #> [1] 44 time_between(episode_date, death_date, unit = "days") #> [1] -44  dob = as.Date("1986-04-01") vaccine_date = as.Date("2023-05-15")  time_between(vaccine_date, dob, unit = "years") #> [1] 37 time_between(dob, vaccine_date, unit = "years") #> [1] -37

title: Extending ggplot2
text: Basic plot using ggplot2:  Now apply theme_apollo apollo_label. Note: using coord_flip horizontal bar charts, set direction “horizontal” within theme_apollo.
code: linelist %>%   count(age_group) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = age_group, y = n)) +   geom_col() +     labs(     title = "Title Goes Here",     subtitle = "Subtitle Goes Here",     x = "Age Groups (Years)",     y = "Percentage (%)"   ) linelist %>%   count(age_group) %>%   mutate(     percent = add_percent(n),     label = n_percent(n, percent, reverse = TRUE)   ) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = age_group, y = percent, label = label)) +   geom_col(fill = "#353D42") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), limits = c(0,55)) +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical") +   labs(     title = "Title Goes Here",     subtitle = "Subtitle Goes Here\n",     x = "Age Groups (Years)",     y = "Percentage (%)"   ) +   apollo_label(vjust = -0.3)

title: Extending ggplot2
text: cases, may want add labels end line plot increase readability. simplest way get data last point time series put filtered data geom_text:
code: ggplot(data = ts, aes(x = date, y = scores, group = site, linetype = site, colour = site)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_x_date(breaks = ts$date, date_labels = "%b\n%Y") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), limits = c(0,100)) +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical") +   scale_colour_manual(values = c(A = "blue", B = "red")) +   apollo_label(data = end_points(ts, date), aes(label = site), hjust = 0) +     labs(     title = "Title Goes Here",     subtitle = "Subtitle Goes Here\n",     x = "Date",     y = "Percentage (%)"   )

title: Extending ggplot2
text: categories long titles (e.g. race/ethnicity), may need option wrap text better fit /next axis. specify amount wrapping, use width argument adjust (lower width = wrapping, higher width = less wrapping). Without wrapping:  wrapping:
code: ggplot(data = re, aes(x = group, y = score, label = score)) +   geom_col() +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), limits = c(0,100)) +   labs(     title = "Title Goes Here",     subtitle = "Subtitle Goes Here\n",     x = "Race/Ethnicity",     y = "Percentage (%)"   ) +   apollo_label(vjust = -0.3) ggplot(data = re, aes(x = group, y = score, label = score)) +   geom_col() +   scale_x_discrete(labels = wrap_labels(width = 15)) +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), limits = c(0,100)) +     labs(     title = "Title Goes Here",     subtitle = "Subtitle Goes Here\n",     x = "Race/Ethnicity",     y = "Percentage (%)"   ) +   apollo_label(vjust = -0.3)

title: Extending ggplot2
text: Dumbbell plots consist two points connected solid line. Useful showing changes pre/post test scores timelines. Dataset requires two x variables (x xend), y variable (character/factor). Speciy within geom_dumbbell: point colors (colour_x colour_xend), line thickness (linewidth), line color (colour), point size (size).
code: ggplot(data = cleveland, aes(x = PRE, xend = POST, y = Country)) +   geom_dumbbell(colour_x = "red", colour_xend = "blue", size = 5, linewidth = 2, colour = "black") +   labs(title = "Dumbbell Plot", x = "Pre/Post Scores", y = "Country") +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical")

title: Extending ggplot2
text: Lollipop Plot similar Cleveland Dot Plot, one point stem.
code: ggplot(data = cleveland, aes(x = Country, y = POST, color = Country)) +   geom_lollipop(colour = "red", size = 5, linewidth = 1) +   labs(title = "Lollipop Plot", x = "Country", y = "Post Score") +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical")

title: Extending ggplot2
text: plots multiple categories, may want draw attention specific group - whether ’s highest/lowest value, group interest, etc. highlight_geom takes two arguments - expression (similar ’d use dplyr::filter), color highlighting. additional arguments points (alpha, size) lines (linewidth). highlighting work facets, function considered experimental used caution. Currently works well geom_col/geom_bar, geom_line, geom_point.
code: ggplot(data = highlight, aes(x = locations, y = scores, label = scores)) +   geom_col() +   facet_wrap(~site) +   highlight_geom(scores == max(scores), pal = "#9E0059") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), limits = c(0,100)) +   theme_apollo(direction = "vertical") +   labs(     title = "Showcasing how highlight_geom() works\n",     caption = "Agency/Unit Name Goes Here."   ) +   apollo_label(vjust = -0.3)

what: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
title: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
text: {OCepi} aims provide standardized approach mundane data wrangling tasks public health epidemiologists. functions included package can broadly applied made specifically epidemiologists county State agencies. package addresses following priorities: standardization recoding demographic data, specifically: ethnicity/race, gender, sexual orientation, age groups ggplot2 extensions elevate data visualizations convert dates weeks, months, years following CDC MMWR schema

title: Add Proportion — add_percent
code: df <- data.frame(species = c("Droid","Human","Wookie"), n = c(3,12,1)) df$percent <- add_percent(df$n) df #>   species  n percent #> 1   Droid  3   18.75 #> 2   Human 12   75.00 #> 3  Wookie  1    6.25

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: object class GeomDumbbell (inherits Geom, ggproto, gg) length 7.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: data Dataframe. mapping Requires following aesthetics: x = starting point, xend = ending point, y = category/factor. show.legend Boolean. inherit.aes TRUE combine default mapping top level plot. position Default set "identity". na.rm Boolean remove NA values. colour_x Color starting point. colour_xend Color ending point. size Size points. linewidth Line thickness. colour Line color. ... args, man.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: Dumbbell plot.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(Country = c("UK-A","US-A","UK-B","US-B"), PRE = c(0,1,2,3), POST = c(4,5,6,7)) ggplot(data = df, aes(x = PRE, xend = POST, y = Country)) +  geom_dumbbell(colour_x = "blue", colour_xend = "red", size = 3, linewidth = 3, colour = "black") +  labs(title = "Dumbbell Plot", x = "Pre/Post Scores", y = "Country")

text: Following CDC MMWR schema, calculate week number based input date.

text: date Input date .e. episode date, specimen collection date.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: Epidemiological week per MMWR schema.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: CDC: first day MMWR week Sunday. MMWR week numbering sequential beginning 1 incrementing week maximum 52 53. MMWR week #1 MMWR year first week year least four days calendar year. example, January 1 occurs Sunday, Monday, Tuesday Wednesday, calendar week includes January 1 MMWR week #1. January 1 occurs Thursday, Friday, Saturday, calendar week includes January 1 last MMWR week previous year (#52 #53). rule, December 29, 30, 31 potentially fall MMWR week #1 following MMWR year.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: Following CDC MMWR schema, calculate year based input date.

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: Epidemiological year per MMWR schema.

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: CDC: first day MMWR week Sunday. MMWR week numbering sequential beginning 1 incrementing week maximum 52 53. MMWR week #1 MMWR year first week year least four days calendar year. example, January 1 occurs Sunday, Monday, Tuesday Wednesday, calendar week includes January 1 MMWR week #1. January 1 occurs Thursday, Friday, Saturday, calendar week includes January 1 last MMWR week previous year (#52 #53). rule, December 29, 30, 31 potentially fall MMWR week #1 following MMWR year.

title: Calculate Incidence Rate per 100,000 — rate_per_100k
text: Calculate incidence rate using population denominator.

Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: Simplify race/ethnicity patient data one variable using CalREDIE, CAIR2, VRBIS datasets. Hierarchy defaults Hispanic/Latinx regardless reported race. Function can handle one (e.g. CAIR2) two inputs (e.g. CalREDIE). using VRBIS dataset, expected input "Multi-status Race" column.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: ethnicity_col Patient ethnicity variable. race_col Patient race variable. abbr_names TRUE/FALSE, option abbreviate long category names.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: Merged race/ethnicity variable.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
code: recode_race("Hispanic","Black or African American") #> [1] "Hispanic/Latinx" recode_race("Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander", abbr_names = FALSE) #> [1] "Native Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander" recode_race("1") #> [1] "White"

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: Ability drop columns either completely NA "".

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: df Input dataframe.

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: Dataframe blank/empty columns removed. Message printed console total columns removed.

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
code: test <- data.frame(a = c(NA,NA,NA), b = c("","",""), c = c(1,2,3)) test <- remove_empty_cols(test) #> 2 columns dropped. test #>   c #> 1 1 #> 2 2 #> 3 3

what: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: Mask values/counts specified threshold maintain patient confidentiality.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: n Input field suppressed. less_than Maximum value suppression. replace_with Value use input field suppressed. String, numeric, NA.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: Suppressed value.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
code: df <- data.frame(Counts = c(5, 1, 10, 3, 12, 9, 4)) df$Counts_Suppressed <- suppress(df$Counts, less_than = 5, replace_with = "**") df #>   Counts Counts_Suppressed #> 1      5                 5 #> 2      1                ** #> 3     10                10 #> 4      3                ** #> 5     12                12 #> 6      9                 9 #> 7      4                **

title: Apollo Theme — theme_apollo
text: Apollo Theme

title: Apollo Theme — theme_apollo
code: theme_apollo(   direction = c("vertical", "horizontal"),   font = NULL,   legend = c("Show", "Hide") )

title: Apollo Theme — theme_apollo
text: direction using coord_flip, specify "horizontal". Otherwise use "vertical". font Option specify font, either system Google fonts. legend Option display legend ("Show") hide ("Hide").

title: Apollo Theme — theme_apollo
text: Theme standard ggplots.

what: Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
title: Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
text: Calculate elapsed time two dates specified unit time. Order dates within necessarily matter, order dictate sign returned output.

title: Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
text: date2 recent date. date1 Older date date past. unit Specify returned time days, weeks, months, years.

title: Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
text: Time interval specified units.

title: Calculate Time Between Two Dates — time_between
code: date2 = as.POSIXlt("2023-02-08 00:10:00 PST") date1 = as.POSIXlt("1986-01-08 22:00:00 PST")  time_between(date2, date1, unit = "days") #> [1] 13544

what: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
text: Standardized method determine death belongs local health jurisdiction.

title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
code: vrbis_resident(   death_location,   county_of_death,   county_fips,   fips = "059",   county_code = "30" )

title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
text: death_location Expects "Place Death (Facility)" column VRBIS dataset. county_of_death Expects "County Death (Code)" column. county_fips Expects "Decedents County Residence (NCHS Code)" column. fips County fips code local health jurisdiction. county_code State county code per Appendix G CCDF data dictionary.

title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
text: 0/1, 1 indicating death belongs local health jurisdiction.

title: Week Ending Date — week_ending_date

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: Wrap long axis labels avoid overcrowding.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: width Higher value = less wrapping, lower value = wrapping. Recommended width 15.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: Wrapped labels.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
code: df <- data.frame(group = c("Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander", "Black or African American","American Indian or Alaska Native"), score = c(89.5, 84, 73))  ggplot(data = df, aes(x = group, y = score)) +  geom_col() +  scale_x_discrete(labels = wrap_labels(width = 15))
